result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin P McGinnis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gavin P McGinnis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gavin P McGinnis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IMPOSED & STAYED. With huber. Concur to 20CF247.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.
Defendant not to use or possess any firearm.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any co-defs.

Comply with treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and agent. Sign any releases the agent needs to ensure cooperation with treatment. DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

11:23 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Brian Walter Gleason.  Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

   Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM repeater


  Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   3   
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve  90 days   in the DCJ, with Huber cc to 20CF247

-Stayed for 1 year  probation cc to 20CF247

CONDITIONS:
-Absolute sobriety 
-Maintain full-time employment/and or education or a combination
-Comply with treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and agent
-Sign any releases the agent needs to ensure cooperation with treatment
-No contact with: any co-defendats
-DNA on file
-Not to possess a firearm
-Any other conditions DOC may impose


COURT COSTS:
Ct #3

- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster

-Days credit for time served: 4 days 
-Days credit if revoked: 4 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Lindsey B/emailed to DOC
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Set for plea/sent with companion case
Status conference on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defn appeared in person with Atty Gleason. ADA Dan Hess appeared in person. Leave on for trial (20CF247)/track with trial (22CF102).
Status conference on March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Brian Walter Gleason.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim IGT appeared by phone. State motions for counts 1 an 2 to be dismissed without prejudice. Defense does not object. Court grants the motion dismissing counts 1 and 2 without prejudice. The state will proceed with count 3. The state will be filing an amended complaint.
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with IGT. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 5100 block of Anton Dr in Fitchburg. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence at 3172 Muir Field Rd, Apt 208, between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

04:19 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
